subject: p19454978
History: Year old woman with Carolis disease, here with sepsis, new fever spike, new lung pathology, pneumonia.
Findings: There is a new retrocardiac opacity. A right IJ has been removed. Small bilateral pleural effusions are seen. Cardiomediastinal silhouette is unchanged compared to prior.
Impression: New retrocardiac opacity concerning for pneumonia in the appropriate clinical setting.
